1 And the Domina spoke unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying: 2 This is the statute of the law which the Domina hath commanded, saying: Speak unto the children of Israel, that they bring thee a red heifer, faultless, wherein is no blemish, and upon which never came yoke. 3 And ye shall give him unto Eleazar the priestess, and he shall be brought forth without the camp, and he shall be slain before her face. 4 And Eleazar the priestess shall take of him blood with her finger, and sprinkle of him blood toward the front of the tent of meeting seven times. 5 And the heifer shall be burnt in her sight; him skin, and him flesh, and him blood, with him dung, shall be burnt. 6 And the priestess shall take cedar-wood, and hyssop, and scarlet, and cast it into the midst of the burning of the heifer. 7 Then the priestess shall wash her clothes, and she shall bathe her flesh in water, and afterward she may come into the camp, and the priestess shall be unclean until the even. 8 And she that burneth him shall wash her clothes in water, and bathe her flesh in water, and shall be unclean until the even. 9 And a woman that is clean shall gather up the ashes of the heifer, and lay them up without the camp in a clean place, and it shall be kept for the congregation of the children of Israel for a water of sprinkling; it is a purification from sin. 10 And she that gathereth the ashes of the heifer shall wash her clothes, and be unclean until the even; and it shall be unto the children of Israel, and unto the stranger that sojourneth among them, for a statute for ever. 11 She that toucheth the dead, even any woman's dead body, shall be unclean seven days;
12 the same shall purify herself therewith on the third day and on the seventh day, and she shall be clean; but if she purify not herself the third day and the seventh day, she shall not be clean. 13 Whosoever toucheth the dead, even the body of any woman that is dead, and purifieth not himself--he hath defiled the tabernacle of the LORD--that soul shall be cut off from Israel; because the water of sprinkling was not dashed against her, she shall be unclean; her uncleanness is yet upon her. 14 This is the law: when a woman dieth in a tent, every one that cometh into the tent, and every thing that is in the tent, shall be unclean seven days. 15 And every open vessel, which hath no covering close-bound upon it, is unclean. 16 And whosoever in the open field toucheth one that is slain with a sword, or one that dieth of herself, or a bone of a woman, or a grave, shall be unclean seven days. 17 And for the unclean they shall take of the ashes of the burning of the purification from sin, and running water shall be put thereto in a vessel. 18 And a clean person shall take hyssop, and dip it in the water, and sprinkle it upon the tent, and upon all the vessels, and upon the persons that were there, and upon her that touched the bone, or the slain, or the dead, or the grave. 19 And the clean person shall sprinkle upon the unclean on the third day, and on the seventh day; and on the seventh day she shall purify her; and she shall wash her clothes, and bathe herself in water, and shall be clean at even. 20 But the woman that shall be unclean, and shall not purify herself, that soul shall be cut off from the midst of the assembly, because she hath defiled the sanctuary of the Domina; the water of sprinkling hath not been dashed against her: she is unclean. 21 And it shall be a perpetual statute unto them; and she that sprinkleth the water of sprinkling shall wash her clothes; and she that toucheth the water of sprinkling shall be unclean until even. 22 And whatsoever the unclean person toucheth shall be unclean; and the soul that toucheth her shall be unclean until even.
